free_text.Content: Basic components,binders,admixtures and adjunctions.[br/][li] Rheology of fresh cementitious materials.[br/][li] Bases of Fibre Reinforced Concretes.[br/][li] Formulation of UHPFRC.[br/][li] Hydration, heat transport, moisture transport. [br/][li] Mechanics of strain hardening fibre reinforced concretes and combination with rebars.[br/][li] Time dependent behaviour of UHPFRC - creep and shrinkage, response under restraint.[br/][li] Applications on new and existing structures - case studies.[br/][li] Ways towards conceptual design of innovative structures with UHPFRC.    [br/]
free_text.Keywords: Cementitious Composites, Fibres, UHPFRC, Strain hardening, Creep, Shrinkage, Formulation, Rheology. Modelling
free_text.Required prior knowledge: Basic course on Building Materials, Continuum Mechanics, Structural Mechanics, Physics and Chemistry
